title: New Year, New Location! Collin Leitch: The Darling Maneuver
html: Twelve Ten Gallery is delighted to begin the New Year at our new location, 1104 Thorndale Ave. Collin Leitch's exhibition, "The Darling Maneuver" opens on January 10th, 2026 from 6-9PM. Normal gallery hours will resume the following week Wed-Sat 1-6PM.

title: 2025 Fall and Winter Updates
html:
Twelve Ten Gallery has been on an extended hiatus while we relocate to 1104 Thorndale Ave. Featuring a fresh build-out and a larger, updated exhibition space, the new location will also offer a dedicated classroom and event space as we continue our partnership with the Brooklyn Institute for Social Research and expand programming. Conveniently located right next to the Thorndale Redline stop, our new location will also be accessible as a ground floor storefront, just down the way from our previous space.

Due to ongoing construction work we now expect to open beginning January 2026.

We are thrilled to inaugerate the new space with a solo exhibition featuring work by New York based artist Collin Leitch on January 10th, 2026.

We are also excited to announce our participation in NADA Miami 2025 featuring Chicago based artist Tali Halpern from December 2-6, 2025.

Finally, we are honored to have been accepted as a NADA member this year, and look forward to contributing to the vibrant community that NADA has fostered.

title: Moving to 1104 Thorndale
html: Twelve Ten Gallery is temporarily closed while we relocate to our new space at 1104 West Thorndale Ave. We will return November 2025 with new programming. Stay tuned!

title: Trey Rozell: Artist Talk April 25th, 6-8PM
html: Twelve Ten Gallery invites you to a conversation with artist Trey Rozell on the occasion of his first solo exhibition with the gallery. His exhibition “As above, so below” presents a unique durational installation of painted canvases whose terms are constantly exchanged, emphasizing the semiotic, performative and sculptural dimensions of painting and its versatility as a medium still at play. To be followed by a reception with refreshments and socializing. Space is limited. Please RSVP.

title: Closed for the season. Re-opening February 15th
html: Thank you to everyone who came out for our fall 2024 progamming! The gallery will be taking a break for the winter season and will return on February 15th with a group show, The Ryleans, featuring Noelle Africh, Ellis & Parker von Sternberg, Jonathan Worcester, and Ziyi Zhang. We look forward to seeing you in the new year!

title: Tali Halpen: (star)E EYED extended through November 2nd
html: We will be extending the run of Tali Halpern's, ★E EYED through to November 2nd. A closing celebration will be held with the artist on that date, from 5-8PM. Exhibition details here.

title: Jason Loebs: COLDBOMB
html:
We are thrilled to announce Jason Loeb's solo exhibition with the gallery, COLDBOMB

The press release may be accessed online here, or in PDF format.

The exhibition will open on November 9th, with a reception from 6-9PM and will run from November 9th to December 21st, 2024. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Tali Halpen: (star)E EYED
html:
We are pleased to announce Tali Halpern's solo exhibition with the gallery, ★E EYED

The press release may be accessed online here, or in PDF format.

The exhibition will open on September 28th, with a reception from 6-9PM and will run from September 28th to October 26th, 2024. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

We will also be holding extended hours concurrent with our participation in Chicago Exhibition Weekend and host an artist talk on Saturday, October 5th, 4-6PM. Space for the talk is limited, so please RSVP.

title: Summer hours: the gallery will be closed August. Re-opening September
html:
Thank you to everyone who participated in and supported us through our first year of programming!

We are incredibly grateful to all of the artists for their collaboration with the gallery, the conversations sparked by the work, and the thoughtful responses in the press and media

The gallery will be closed for the month of August with new programming scheduled for September. Watch this space or join our newsletter for updates.

The exhibition will open on June 8th, with a reception from 6-9PM and will run from June 8th to July 27th, 2024. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Amanda Beech: Delphic Future extended
html: We are pleased to announce that Amanda Beech: Delphic Future will be extended through to Saturday, March 23rd. The gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Amanda Beech and Ellis von Sternberg in conversation
html: Ellis von Sternberg has interviewed Amanda Beech regarding her recent work and the exhibition at Twelve Ten Gallery. The full interview may be accessed online here, or in PDF format

title: Amanda Beech: Delphic Future
html:
Twelve Ten Gallery is pleased to present new paintings and drawings by Amanda Beech, accompanied by an installation of the video work Covenant Transport Move or Die (2015) and a special one-night US premiere of her 2022 film Map of the Bomb (commissioned by Fieldwork Marfa). The press release may be accessed online here, or in PDF format.

The exhibition will open on Sunday, February 4th, with a reception from 5-8PM. Map of the Bomb will be presented at the Music Box Theatre on Tuesday, February 6th from 7-9PM and will be followed by a brief discussion with the artist. Free and open to the public as capacity allows.

The exhibition will run from February 4th to March 16th, 2024. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Bullet Hell closing and curator walkthrough with curator David Mitchell
html:
Last week to see "Bullet Hell" before it closes on January 12th. As a final celebration of the show and artists, we will host a special walkthrough with curator David Mitchell, where he will share his insights into the exhibition, and what inspired the connection between the works on view. Refreshments will be available.

"Bullet Hell" featuring Sam Dickey, Helmut Hammen, Trey Rozell is open Wed-Sat. 1-6PM through Friday, January 12th, 2024.

title: Holiday Hours
html: The gallery will be closed for the holiday beginning the week of December 18th and resume normal hours on December 27th. Our current exhibition, Bullet Hell, featuring Sam Dickey, Helmut Hammen, and Trey Rozell, curated by David Mitchell will be on view until January 12th.

title: Sam Dickey, Helmut Hammen, & Trey Rozell in 'Bullet Hell', curated by David Mitchell
html:
We are excited to announce Bullet Hell featuring Sam Dickey, Helmut Hammen and Trey Rozell, curated by David Mitchell.

The press release may be accessed online here, or in PDF format.

The exhibition will open on November 17th, with a reception from 6-9PM and will run from November 17th to January 12th, 2024. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Hosting the Brooklyn Institute for Social Reaserch
html:
We are pleased to announce a partnership with the Brooklyn Institute for Social Research! Coming this November, we will begin hosting their first in-person course for the Chicago area:

Critical Theory and the Now: a Contemporary Introduction to the Frankfurt School
Instructor: Audrey Nicolaides
Thursday, 6:30-9:30pm CT
November 16 — December 14, 2023
4 sessions over 5 weeks
Class will not meet Thursday, November 23rd.

In 1930, Max Horkheimer became the director of the Institute for Social Research in Frankfurt, Germany. Along with his colleagues and a broader orbit of external scholars, he inaugurated the first wave of what came to be called “critical theory.” This course is an introduction to some of the key works and concepts of the Frankfurt School, including thinkers like Horkheimer, Theodor Adorno, and Walter Benjamin, in the context of a comparative analysis of the cultural and political landscape of the mid-twentieth century and that of today. What is historical materialism? What is the “dialectic of enlightenment”? How does the “culture industry” work? What, if any, are the connections and boundaries between philosophy sociology, aesthetics, art, history, and religion? Drawing on readings from several Frankfurt School texts, particularly Adorno and Horkheimer's Dialectic of Enlightenment, we will attempt to read, understand, and evaluate these questions and link them to the contemporary world.

More information and enrollment here

title: Inaugural Exhibition: Speedrunners
html:
We are excited to announce our inaugural exhibition, Speedrunners featuring Isabelle Frances McGuire, Ryan Nault, Liz Vitlin, and Ellis & Parker von Sternberg.

The exhibition will open on September 29th, with a reception from 6-9PM and will run from September 29th to November 11th, 2023. Gallery hours are 1:00PM to 6:00PM, Wednesday through Saturday or by appointment.

title: Preparing for launch at our new location in Chicago
html: We are pleased to announce that we will be opening at 1210 Thorndale Ave., Chicago IL 60660 soon! Sign up to our mailing list for more details about our inaugural show, upcoming exhibits, artists, and more.
